channel.title: Portfolios on Mark LeBoeuf
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on Mark LeBoeuf

item.title: Forecasting with External Regressors
item.description: This post focuses on some of my favorite things: Data, Sports, and Forecasting. Today we’ll discuss how to leverage external regressors when creating forecasts. We’ll do some webscraping in R and Python to create our dataset, and then try to forecast how many people will Visit Tom Brady’s wikipedia page.

item.title: Two Flavors of Parallel Simulation
item.description: Tired of waiting around for your simulations to finish? Run them in parallel! This post covers two seperate ways to add parallelism – and speed – to your R code.

item.title: Random Forest Prediction Intervals
item.description: Take a stroll through the random forest to learn how to quantify uncertainty in your predictions with one of the more popular applied machine learning algorithms.

item.title: Time Series Outlier Detection
item.description: Does this look weird? Find out a straightforward approach to detecting and replacing outliers in time series.

item.title: Monte Carlo Power Calculations for Mixed Effects Models
item.description: That’s a dense title – Monte Carlo Simulation, Power, Mixed-Effect models. Each of these topics could be their own post. However, I’m going to discuss their interrelations in the context of experimental power and keep everything high-level. The goal is to get an intuitive idea of how we can leverage simulation to provide sample size estimates for experiments with nested data.

item.title: Name of the work 6
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Name of the work 7
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Item with image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.
